item.title: Denise add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Denise add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Denise add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "California deserves whatever it gets. Californians invented the concept of life-style. This alone warrants their doom." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Denise add a quote by Charlie Schultz
item.description: "Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, 'Where have I gone wrong'. Then a voice says to me, 'This is going to take more than one night." -- Charlie Schultz

item.title: Denise add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "She had no tolerance for scenes which were not of her own making." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Denise add a quote by Adam Gopnik
item.description: "American long for a closed society in which everything can be bought, where laborers are either hidden away or dressed up as nonhumans, so as not to be disconcerting. This place is called Disney World" -- Adam Gopnik

item.title: Denise add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Denise add a quote by Will Rodgers
item.description: "Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there. " -- Will Rodgers

item.title: Denise add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "If you want a happy ending, that depends, of course, on where you stop your story." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Denise add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Denise add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "There had to be dark and muddy waters so that the sun could have something to background it's flashing glory." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Denise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Denise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Denise add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Denise add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that. You forget some things, dont you? Yes. You forget what you want to remember and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Denise add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I know why we try to keep the dead alive: we try to keep them alive in order to keep them with us. I also know that if we are to live ourselves there comes a point at which we must relinquish the dead, let them go, keep them dead. " -- Joan Didion

item.title: Denise add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "One thing in my defense, not that it matters: I know something Carter never knew, or Helene, or maybe you. I know what "nothing" means, and keep on playing." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Denise add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "You can go other places, all right - you can live on the other side of the world, but you can't ever leave home" -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Denise add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Denise add a quote by Jessica Anya Blau
item.description: "She understands suddenly that the stuff that fills her up is not the love or attention she might get from other people; it is the love she herself has for other people. We are, Portia decides, the people we love" -- Jessica Anya Blau

item.title: Denise add a quote by Anita Diamant
item.description: "Death is no enemy, but the foundation of gratitude, sympathy, and art. Of all life's pleasures, only love owes no debt to death." -- Anita Diamant
